*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Samuel M. Williams, Bexar, December 6, 1832, Describing procedure leading to a strong petition for redress of grievances and reforms for Texas. */p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*Austin to Samuel M Williams*/p*
*p*[From Williams Papers, Rosenberg Library, Galveston, Tex.]*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Bexar */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="12-06-1832">6 December 1832*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*S.M.W.*/p*
*p*Dr Sir, I arrived here on the *date_mentioned n="12-03-1832">3 inst*/date_mentioned*—*date_mentioned n="12-05-1832">yesterday */date_mentioned*there was a meeting of the *person_mentioned*principal citizens*/person_mentioned*—that is the *person_mentioned*Chief—Erasmo [Seguin]*/person_mentioned*— the *person_mentioned*Navarros*/person_mentioned*—*person_mentioned*Col. Elosua*/person_mentioned*—*person_mentioned*Balmaceda*/person_mentioned*—*person_mentioned*Flores*/person_mentioned*—*person_mentioned*Garza */person_mentioned*etc, and I gave them an exact discription of the evils that are retarding the progress of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*. Stated in plain terms the necessity of separating from *location_mentioned*Coahuila*/location_mentioned*, and the desire of the *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*generally to do so— and said everything I could to induce them to concur in taking that step at once.*/p*
*p*The matter was discussed and talked over with great calmness and interest. There was not a dissenting voice as to the necessity of a remidy and all agreed that a separation from *location_mentioned*Coahuila */location_mentioned*was the best, but they thought it precipitate to take that step before any representations of our grievances were made to the *person_mentioned*Govt*/person_mentioned*. This they considered a necessary preliminary step. Finding that they would not agree to go into the meas[ure] [before] the intermediate step of representing had been resorted to, I urged the absolute importance of proceeding immediately to take that step, by the *person_mentioned*Ayuntamto */person_mentioned*of this place—that All the grievances should be plainly and firmly stated, and that the remonstrance should terminate with a positive declaration that if our grievances were not fully redressed by the *date_mentioned n="03-01-1833">first day of March next*/date_mentioned*, *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*would then proceed immediately to organize a *person_mentioned*local Government*/person_mentioned*—they agreed to this, but thought *date_mentioned n="03-xx-1833">March*/date_mentioned* too short a time and *date_mentioned n="04-xx-1833">April */date_mentioned*was proposed and I think will be agreed to.*/p*
*p*The conference was unofficial, of course,—it lasted from nine A. M. to 2 P. M.—they were unanimous, and I have full confidence that what was agreed on will be carried into effect.*/p*
*p*The *person_mentioned*Ayuntamto */person_mentioned*is now in session on this matter to appoint a *person_mentioned*committee */person_mentioned*to draw up the remonstrance, and I am of opinion that the [most impatient man?] in *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, will have no reason [to say that] it is too mild. They called on [me to] furnish the heads— besides those [acted] on by the convention, I have given [some?] others, including the whole system of the *person_mentioned*local administration*/person_mentioned*—of colonization—of the *person_mentioned*militia*/person_mentioned*—all the violations of the constitution— the insults offered to *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, by the outrage on her *person_mentioned*representatives */person_mentioned*in *date_mentioned n="09-xx-1830">Sept. 1830*/date_mentioned*—the law No. 50—the retail law, the insult offered to the *person_mentioned*Lieut. Govr */person_mentioned*by calling a *person_mentioned*judge */person_mentioned*to exercise the government etc, etc, usurpations—the neglect of the *person_mentioned*Govt*/person_mentioned*, towards the *person_mentioned*people to the *location_mentioned*east of my colony*/location_mentioned* and in *location_mentioned*La Bahia*/location_mentioned* etc*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*The object is to form a list of all the insults offered to *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, and all her grievances and to demand, full satisfaction. If it is not granted, *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*can then say to *location_mentioned*Coahuila */location_mentioned*and to the *location_mentioned*world*/location_mentioned*—we were insulted and oppressed—we asked redress—it was refused, and we have redressed * * * [If I succeed] in getting this *person_mentioned*Ayto */person_mentioned*to [pass] this remonstrance, as I have pro[posed] and as was agreed to in the conference *date_mentioned n="12-05-1832">[yester]day,*/date_mentioned* it will place *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*on much better ground than to go into the measure now, and it will unite *location_mentioned*this place and La Bahia*/location_mentioned* firmly with the balance of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, for they will be so compromised that there will be no backing out, even if they wished to do so; which they will not, for they are as anxious for a separation as we are, but wish to show to the world that they are right, and stand on just ground in case force must ultimately be resorted to.*/p*
*p*I will return as soon as this matter is concluded.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Ramon Musquis*/person_mentioned*, after all, is one of the *person_mentioned*best friends to *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*and the truest that lives in this place and he deserves the confidence of the *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*and of *location_mentioned*all Texas.*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Arciniegas family */person_mentioned*are [well] Some one stole five dollars of the money * * *. I paid it to make it $40.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Committee: Angel Navarro, Cosiano of the Ayto., Erasmo, Balmaceda, and Antonio Navarro.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
